page.title: 12WATER SUPPLY
page.content: There are{two covered reservoirs}in the area, a small one about 1 1/2 kilometres S.S.E. of Bradbourne, and a larger reservoir near the B5035 Wirksworth/Ashbourne Road. The latter is known as HOGNASTON RESERVOIR. This is a square shaped tank with re-inforced base and walls made of concrete. The{water tank,}which is covered to prevent contamination, has a capacity of {150,000}galls. and is on high ground in order to gravity feed potable,treated water to local places. The Severn Trent Water Authority is proposing to extend the outflow capacity of this tank, which is a common type in the area . The earth, dug out to construct the tank was mounded up the sides to provide insulation. It is supplied from the covered reservoir at Wirksworth.
